TEXT.English: When checked, you can create messages using Alt-M that pop up in a specified number of turns using eotinb's Reminders mod.
TEXT.French: When checked, you can create messages using Alt-M that pop up in a specified number of turns using eotinb's Reminders mod.
TEXT.German: Ermöglicht das Schreiben von Erinnerungsmeldungen (Tastenkombination [ALT-M]), die nach einer bestimmten Anzahl Runden wieder erscheinen (verwendet "eotinbs Reminders" Mod)
TEXT.Italian: When checked, you can create messages using Alt-M that pop up in a specified number of turns using eotinb's Reminders mod.
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, you can create messages using Alt-M that pop up in a specified number of turns using eotinb's Reminders mod.

TEXT.English: Determines how reminders are displayed to you:[NEWLINE]- On-screen message with entry in the log[NEWLINE]- A modal popup message with the option to retrigger the event next turn[NEWLINE]- Both
TEXT.French: Determines how reminders are displayed to you:[NEWLINE]- On-screen message with entry in the log[NEWLINE]- A modal popup message with the option to retrigger the event next turn[NEWLINE]- Both
TEXT.German: Bestimmt die Anzeigemethode für Erinnerungen:[NEWLINE]- Meldung: einfache Meldung mit einem Eintrag im Log[NEWLINE]- Popup: Dialogfenster mit der Möglichkeit, die Meldung in der nächsten Runde erneut anzeigen zu lassen[NEWLINE]- Beides
TEXT.Italian: Determines how reminders are displayed to you:[NEWLINE]- On-screen message with entry in the log[NEWLINE]- A modal popup message with the option to retrigger the event next turn[NEWLINE]- Both
TEXT.Spanish: Determines how reminders are displayed to you:[NEWLINE]- On-screen message with entry in the log[NEWLINE]- A modal popup message with the option to retrigger the event next turn[NEWLINE]- Both

TEXT.French: When checked, reminders will be logged using Autolog when created and triggered.

TEXT.Spanish: When checked, reminders will be logged using Autolog when created and triggered.

TEXT.Spanish: Directory where log file resides (fully qualified path, i.e. C:\folder\subfolder or blank).

TEXT.English: Name of log file. If there is no file of this name in the directory above, one will be created.

TEXT.Spanish: The format of the log output.

TEXT.English: Plain|HTML Tags|Forum Tags, With " around color codes|Forum Tags, No " around color codes
TEXT.French: Plain|HTML Tags|Forum Tags, With " around color codes|Forum Tags, No " around color codes

TEXT.English: When checked, puts anger countdown on city screen.

TEXT.Italian: When checked, puts anger countdown on city screen.
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, puts anger countdown on city screen.

TEXT.English: Determines how specialists are displayed:[NEWLINE]- Default: Shows specialists using the vanilla BtS format.[NEWLINE]- Stacker: Shows specialists stacked using the Stacked Specialist mod.[NEWLINE]- Chevron: Shows specialists grouped into 5 (single chevron), 10 (capped chevron) and 20 (boxed capped chevron) format.
TEXT.French: Determines how specialists are displayed:[NEWLINE]- Default: Shows specialists using the vanilla BtS format.[NEWLINE]- Stacker: Shows specialists stacked using the Stacked Specialist mod.[NEWLINE]- Chevron: Shows specialists grouped into 5 (single chevron), 10 (capped chevron) and 20 (boxed capped chevron) format.
TEXT.German: Bestimmt die Anordnung der Spezialisten im Stadt-Bildschirm:[NEWLINE]- Standard: Spezialisten werden wie in "Beyond the Sword" angeordnet[NEWLINE]- Stapel: Spezialisten werden gestapelt angeordnet (verwendet die "Stacked Specialist" Mod)[NEWLINE]- Chevron: Spezialisten werden zu Gruppen aus 5 (einfaches Chevron), 10 (geschlossenes Chevron) und 20 (eingerahmtes geschlossenes Chevron) Spezialisten zusammengefasst
TEXT.Italian: Determines how specialists are displayed:[NEWLINE]- Default: Shows specialists using the vanilla BtS format.[NEWLINE]- Stacker: Shows specialists stacked using the Stacked Specialist mod.[NEWLINE]- Chevron: Shows specialists grouped into 5 (single chevron), 10 (capped chevron) and 20 (boxed capped chevron) format.
TEXT.Spanish: Determines how specialists are displayed:[NEWLINE]- Default: Shows specialists using the vanilla BtS format.[NEWLINE]- Stacker: Shows specialists stacked using the Stacked Specialist mod.[NEWLINE]- Chevron: Shows specialists grouped into 5 (single chevron), 10 (capped chevron) and 20 (boxed capped chevron) format.

TEXT.English: Default color used for espionage ratios.

TEXT.Italian: Default color used for espionage ratios.
TEXT.Spanish: Default color used for espionage ratios.

TEXT.English: Ratios less than or equal to this value are colored with the following color.
TEXT.French: Ratios less than or equal to this value are colored with the following color.

TEXT.English: Color used for missions that you can perform now (you have enough EPs against the target).

TEXT.Spanish: Color used for missions that you can perform now (you have enough EPs against the target).

TEXT.English: When checked, dead civilizations will remain on the scoreboard.
TEXT.French: When checked, dead civilizations will remain on the scoreboard.

TEXT.French: When checked, dead civilizations will be tagged as "Dead" when shown.

TEXT.Spanish: When checked, dead civilizations will be tagged as "Dead" when shown.

TEXT.English: When checked, shows faces depicting each AI's attitude toward you.
TEXT.French: When checked, shows faces depicting each AI's attitude toward you.
TEXT.German: Zeigt die Einstellung jedes Computerspielers gegenüber der eigenen Zivilisation als Smiley an
TEXT.Italian: When checked, shows faces depicting each AI's attitude toward you.
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, shows faces depicting each AI's attitude toward you.

TEXT.English: When checked, the scoreboard is drawn as a grid, and the other options in this column affect it.
TEXT.French: When checked, the scoreboard is drawn as a grid, and the other options in this column affect it.
TEXT.German: Stellt die Wertungsanzeige als Raster dar, um die folgenden Optionen nutzen zu können
TEXT.Italian: When checked, the scoreboard is drawn as a grid, and the other options in this column affect it.
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, the scoreboard is drawn as a grid, and the other options in this column affect it.

TEXT.English: This determines the order in which the score columns appear.[NEWLINE]S - The civ's score.[NEWLINE]C - The civ's/leader's name.[NEWLINE]? - You have not yet met the civ.[NEWLINE]W - You are at war with the civ.[NEWLINE]E - You have a positive espionage point ratio against the civ.[NEWLINE]P - The civ's power ratio compared to you.[NEWLINE]T - The tech the civ is researching (vassals, teammates and espionage).[NEWLINE]U - The number of research turns left.[NEWLINE]N - The civ is connected to your trade network.[NEWLINE]B - You have an open borders agreement with the civ.[NEWLINE]D - You have a defensive pact with the civ.[NEWLINE]R - The civ's state religion.[NEWLINE]A - The civ's attitude toward you.[NEWLINE]* - You are waiting for this civ to finish its turn.[NEWLINE]L - Civ's network stats (ping).[NEWLINE]O - The network player is out-of-sync.
TEXT.French: This determines the order in which the score columns appear.[NEWLINE]S - The civ's score.[NEWLINE]C - The civ's/leader's name.[NEWLINE]? - You have not yet met the civ.[NEWLINE]W - You are at war with the civ.[NEWLINE]E - You have a positive espionage point ratio against the civ.[NEWLINE]P - The civ's power ratio compared to you.[NEWLINE]T - The tech the civ is researching (vassals, teammates and espionage).[NEWLINE]U - The number of research turns left.[NEWLINE]N - The civ is connected to your trade network.[NEWLINE]B - You have an open borders agreement with the civ.[NEWLINE]D - You have a defensive pact with the civ.[NEWLINE]R - The civ's state religion.[NEWLINE]A - The civ's attitude toward you.[NEWLINE]* - You are waiting for this civ to finish its turn.[NEWLINE]L - Civ's network stats (ping).[NEWLINE]O - The network player is out-of-sync.
TEXT.German: Bestimmt die Reihenfolge, in der die Spalten der Wertungsanzeige angeordnet werden:[NEWLINE]S - Wertung der Zivilisation[NEWLINE]C - Name der Zivilisation/des Oberhaupts[NEWLINE]? - Zivilisation noch nicht kontaktiert[NEWLINE]W - Kriegszustand[NEWLINE]E - Gutes Spionagepunktverhältnis gegenüber der Zivilisation[NEWLINE]P - Punkteverhältnis zwischen der Zivilisation und der eigenen[NEWLINE]T - Derzeitiges Forschungsprojekt der Zivilisation (gilt für Vasallen, Verbündete und durch Spionage erlangt)[NEWLINE]U - Anzahl verbleibender Runden bis zur Erforschung[NEWLINE]N - Handelsverbindungen mit der Zivilisation[NEWLINE]B - "Offene Grenzen" mit der Zivilisation[NEWLINE]D - "Verteidigungsbündis" mit der Zivilisation[NEWLINE]R - Staatsreligion der Zivilisation[NEWLINE]A - Einstellung der Zivilisation gegenüber der eigenen[NEWLINE]* - Warten auf den Zug der Zivilisation[NEWLINE]L - Netzwerkstatistik der Zivilisation (Ping)[NEWLINE]O - Verbundener Spieler ist "out-of-sync"
TEXT.Italian: This determines the order in which the score columns appear.[NEWLINE]S - The civ's score.[NEWLINE]C - The civ's/leader's name.[NEWLINE]? - You have not yet met the civ.[NEWLINE]W - You are at war with the civ.[NEWLINE]E - You have a positive espionage point ratio against the civ.[NEWLINE]P - The civ's power ratio compared to you.[NEWLINE]T - The tech the civ is researching (vassals, teammates and espionage).[NEWLINE]U - The number of research turns left.[NEWLINE]N - The civ is connected to your trade network.[NEWLINE]B - You have an open borders agreement with the civ.[NEWLINE]D - You have a defensive pact with the civ.[NEWLINE]R - The civ's state religion.[NEWLINE]A - The civ's attitude toward you.[NEWLINE]* - You are waiting for this civ to finish its turn.[NEWLINE]L - Civ's network stats (ping).[NEWLINE]O - The network player is out-of-sync.
TEXT.Spanish: This determines the order in which the score columns appear.[NEWLINE]S - The civ's score.[NEWLINE]C - The civ's/leader's name.[NEWLINE]? - You have not yet met the civ.[NEWLINE]W - You are at war with the civ.[NEWLINE]E - You have a positive espionage point ratio against the civ.[NEWLINE]P - The civ's power ratio compared to you.[NEWLINE]T - The tech the civ is researching (vassals, teammates and espionage).[NEWLINE]U - The number of research turns left.[NEWLINE]N - The civ is connected to your trade network.[NEWLINE]B - You have an open borders agreement with the civ.[NEWLINE]D - You have a defensive pact with the civ.[NEWLINE]R - The civ's state religion.[NEWLINE]A - The civ's attitude toward you.[NEWLINE]* - You are waiting for this civ to finish its turn.[NEWLINE]L - Civ's network stats (ping).[NEWLINE]O - The network player is out-of-sync.

TEXT.Spanish: When checked, puts unit actions text on unit icons.

TEXT.English: When checked, puts a little gold star on units lead by a Great General.
TEXT.French: When checked, puts a little gold star on units lead by a Great General.
TEXT.German: Fügt den Einheitensymbolen von Einheiten, die von Großen Generälen geführt werden, einen kleinen goldenen Stern hinzu
TEXT.Italian: When checked, puts a little gold star on units lead by a Great General.
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, puts a little gold star on units lead by a Great General.

TEXT.English: When checked, uses the Customizable Domestic Advisor (requires restart).
TEXT.French: When checked, uses the Customizable Domestic Advisor (requires restart).
TEXT.German: Aktiviert den anpassbaren Inlandsberater (verwendet "Cammagnos Customizable Domestic Advisor Pages" Mod; erfordert Neustart)
TEXT.Italian: When checked, uses the Customizable Domestic Advisor (requires restart).
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, uses the Customizable Domestic Advisor (requires restart).

TEXT.English: When checked, displays the 'Glance' tab on the Exotic Foreign Advisor screen.
TEXT.French: When checked, displays the 'Glance' tab on the Exotic Foreign Advisor screen.
TEXT.German: Zeigt einen zusätzlichen Kurzüberblick im Bildschirm des Auslandsberaters an
TEXT.Italian: When checked, displays the 'Glance' tab on the Exotic Foreign Advisor screen.
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, displays the 'Glance' tab on the Exotic Foreign Advisor screen.

TEXT.English: When checked, the 'Glance' tab shows Smilies (attitude icons).
TEXT.French: When checked, the 'Glance' tab shows Smilies (attitude icons).
TEXT.Italian: When checked, the 'Glance' tab shows Smilies (attitude icons).
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, the 'Glance' tab shows Smilies (attitude icons).

TEXT.English: When checked, displays the 'Sit Rep' tab on the Military Advisor screen.
TEXT.French: When checked, displays the 'Sit Rep' tab on the Military Advisor screen.
TEXT.German: Zeigt einen Situationsbericht im Bildschirm des Militärberaters an
TEXT.Italian: When checked, displays the 'Sit Rep' tab on the Military Advisor screen.
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, displays the 'Sit Rep' tab on the Military Advisor screen.

TEXT.English: When checked, displays the technology each type of great person will research.
TEXT.French: When checked, displays the technology each type of great person will research.
TEXT.German: Zeigt die Technologien an, die jeder Typ einer Großen Persönlichkeit erforschen kann
TEXT.Italian: When checked, displays the technology each type of great person will research.
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, displays the technology each type of great person will research.

TEXT.English: When checked, the width of the tech screen will be linked to your screen resolution (requires reload to take effect).
TEXT.French: When checked, the width of the tech screen will be linked to your screen resolution (requires reload to take effect).
TEXT.German: Koppelt die Breite des Technologiebaums an die Bildschirmauflösung (erfordert Neustart)
TEXT.Italian: When checked, the width of the tech screen will be linked to your screen resolution (requires reload to take effect).
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, the width of the tech screen will be linked to your screen resolution (requires reload to take effect).

TEXT.English: When checked, uses the Sevopedia (requires restart).
TEXT.French: When checked, uses the Sevopedia (requires restart).
TEXT.Italian: When checked, uses the Sevopedia (requires restart).
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, uses the Sevopedia (requires restart).

TEXT.English: When checked, the lists of units, buildings, technologies, etc. are sorted.
TEXT.French: When checked, the lists of units, buildings, technologies, etc. are sorted.
TEXT.German: Sortiert die Listen der Einheiten, Gebäuden, Technologien etc.
TEXT.Italian: When checked, the lists of units, buildings, technologies, etc. are sorted.
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, the lists of units, buildings, technologies, etc. are sorted.

TEXT.English: When checked, uses the formats on this tab and in the INI file to name the player's units. Names can be built from plain text and format codes that appear between matching carets (^).[NEWLINE]- e.g. "^cv^ ^ut^ from ^ct^" --> "American Archer from Boston"[NEWLINE]General Codes:[NEWLINE]- civ4 - Use built-in Civ4 names[NEWLINE]- rd - Random name[NEWLINE]- rc - Random civ-related name[NEWLINE]Unit Info Codes:[NEWLINE]- ct - City where unit was built (e.g. Boston)[NEWLINE]- cv - Civilization that built the unit in adjective form (e.g. American)[NEWLINE]- ut - Unit type (e.g. Archer)[NEWLINE]- cb - Combat type (e.g. Melee)[NEWLINE]- dm - Domain type (e.g. Water)[NEWLINE]- ld - Leader that built the unit (e.g. Roosevelt)[NEWLINE]Counting Codes:[NEWLINE]- cnt[f] - Count across all units[NEWLINE]- cntu[f] - Count per unit type[NEWLINE]- cntct[f] - Count per city[NEWLINE]- cntuct[f] - Count per unit/city combination[NEWLINE]- cntc[f] - Count per combat type[NEWLINE]- cntd[f] - Count per domain[NEWLINE]- tt1[f][x:y] - Count up to a number chosen between x and y[NEWLINE]- tt1[f][x] - Count from x, incrementing each time tt1 code is reset[NEWLINE]* f in [f] is one of s, A, a, p, g, n, o, r (see help file)
TEXT.French: When checked, uses the formats on this tab and in the INI file to name the player's units. Names can be built from plain text and format codes that appear between matching carets (^).[NEWLINE]- e.g. "^cv^ ^ut^ from ^ct^" --> "American Archer from Boston"[NEWLINE]General Codes:[NEWLINE]- civ4 - Use built-in Civ4 names[NEWLINE]- rd - Random name[NEWLINE]- rc - Random civ-related name[NEWLINE]Unit Info Codes:[NEWLINE]- ct - City where unit was built (e.g. Boston)[NEWLINE]- cv - Civilization that built the unit in adjective form (e.g. American)[NEWLINE]- ut - Unit type (e.g. Archer)[NEWLINE]- cb - Combat type (e.g. Melee)[NEWLINE]- dm - Domain type (e.g. Water)[NEWLINE]- ld - Leader that built the unit (e.g. Roosevelt)[NEWLINE]Counting Codes:[NEWLINE]- cnt[f] - Count across all units[NEWLINE]- cntu[f] - Count per unit type[NEWLINE]- cntct[f] - Count per city[NEWLINE]- cntuct[f] - Count per unit/city combination[NEWLINE]- cntc[f] - Count per combat type[NEWLINE]- cntd[f] - Count per domain[NEWLINE]- tt1[f][x:y] - Count up to a number chosen between x and y[NEWLINE]- tt1[f][x] - Count from x, incrementing each time tt1 code is reset[NEWLINE]* f in [f] is one of s, A, a, p, g, n, o, r (see help file)
TEXT.German: Bestimmt die Benennung eigener Einheiten mit Hilfe der Regeln hier und in der entsprechenden INI-Datei. Die Benennung kann aus Klartext und Formatierungscodes zwischen zwei Zirkumflexen (^) bestehen:[NEWLINE]- z.B. "^cv^ ^ut^ aus ^ct^" --> "Amerikanischer Bogenschütze aus Boston"[NEWLINE]Allgemeine Codes:[NEWLINE]- civ4 - Standard Civ4-Namen verwenden[NEWLINE]- rd - Zufälliger Name[NEWLINE]- rc - Zufälliger zivilisationsbezogener Name[NEWLINE]Codes für Einheiteninfos:[NEWLINE]- ct - Stadt, die die Einheit aufgestellt hat (z.B. Boston)[NEWLINE]- cv - Adjektiv der Zivilisation, die die Einheit aufgestellt hat (z.B. amerikanisch)[NEWLINE]- ut - Einheitentyp (z.B. Bogenschütze)[NEWLINE]- cb - Einheitenklasse (z.B. Nahkampf)[NEWLINE]- dm - Element (z.B. Wasser)[NEWLINE]- ld - Oberhaupt, das die Einheit aufgestellt hat (z.B. Roosevelt)[NEWLINE]Nummerierungscodes:[NEWLINE]- cnt[f] - Nummerierung über alle Einheiten[NEWLINE]- cntu[f] - Nummerierung über alle Einheiten gleichen Typs[NEWLINE]- cntct[f] - Nummerierung pro Stadt[NEWLINE]- cntuct[f] - Nummerierung pro Einheitentyp/Stadt in Kombination[NEWLINE]- cntc[f] - Nummerierung pro Einheitenklasse[NEWLINE]- cntd[f] - Nummerierung pro Element[NEWLINE]- tt1[f][x:y] - Nummerierung mit einer festgelegten Zahl zwischen x und y[NEWLINE]- tt1[f][x] - Nummerierung beginnt mit x und wächst jedes Mal an, wenn der Code tt1 zurückgesetzt wird[NEWLINE]* f in [f] kann auch s, A, a, p, g, n, o, r sein (siehe Hilfedatei)
TEXT.Italian: When checked, uses the formats on this tab and in the INI file to name the player's units. Names can be built from plain text and format codes that appear between matching carets (^).[NEWLINE]- e.g. "^cv^ ^ut^ from ^ct^" --> "American Archer from Boston"[NEWLINE]General Codes:[NEWLINE]- civ4 - Use built-in Civ4 names[NEWLINE]- rd - Random name[NEWLINE]- rc - Random civ-related name[NEWLINE]Unit Info Codes:[NEWLINE]- ct - City where unit was built (e.g. Boston)[NEWLINE]- cv - Civilization that built the unit in adjective form (e.g. American)[NEWLINE]- ut - Unit type (e.g. Archer)[NEWLINE]- cb - Combat type (e.g. Melee)[NEWLINE]- dm - Domain type (e.g. Water)[NEWLINE]- ld - Leader that built the unit (e.g. Roosevelt)[NEWLINE]Counting Codes:[NEWLINE]- cnt[f] - Count across all units[NEWLINE]- cntu[f] - Count per unit type[NEWLINE]- cntct[f] - Count per city[NEWLINE]- cntuct[f] - Count per unit/city combination[NEWLINE]- cntc[f] - Count per combat type[NEWLINE]- cntd[f] - Count per domain[NEWLINE]- tt1[f][x:y] - Count up to a number chosen between x and y[NEWLINE]- tt1[f][x] - Count from x, incrementing each time tt1 code is reset[NEWLINE]* f in [f] is one of s, A, a, p, g, n, o, r (see help file)
TEXT.Spanish: When checked, uses the formats on this tab and in the INI file to name the player's units. Names can be built from plain text and format codes that appear between matching carets (^).[NEWLINE]- e.g. "^cv^ ^ut^ from ^ct^" --> "American Archer from Boston"[NEWLINE]General Codes:[NEWLINE]- civ4 - Use built-in Civ4 names[NEWLINE]- rd - Random name[NEWLINE]- rc - Random civ-related name[NEWLINE]Unit Info Codes:[NEWLINE]- ct - City where unit was built (e.g. Boston)[NEWLINE]- cv - Civilization that built the unit in adjective form (e.g. American)[NEWLINE]- ut - Unit type (e.g. Archer)[NEWLINE]- cb - Combat type (e.g. Melee)[NEWLINE]- dm - Domain type (e.g. Water)[NEWLINE]- ld - Leader that built the unit (e.g. Roosevelt)[NEWLINE]Counting Codes:[NEWLINE]- cnt[f] - Count across all units[NEWLINE]- cntu[f] - Count per unit type[NEWLINE]- cntct[f] - Count per city[NEWLINE]- cntuct[f] - Count per unit/city combination[NEWLINE]- cntc[f] - Count per combat type[NEWLINE]- cntd[f] - Count per domain[NEWLINE]- tt1[f][x:y] - Count up to a number chosen between x and y[NEWLINE]- tt1[f][x] - Count from x, incrementing each time tt1 code is reset[NEWLINE]* f in [f] is one of s, A, a, p, g, n, o, r (see help file)
